kit101

Class Poet

  • java.lang.Object
    • kit101.Poet

  • public class Poet
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that simulates one of three poets at random. Usage:
    Declare an object reference of type Poet and then instantiate it using new: 
     Poet p;
 p = new Poet();

    This class contains a debug(String) method for tracing execution; in larger projects there are more robust ways of logging what is happening in a program.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Poet()
      Creates a new Poet, where the actual poet is selected randomly.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Returns the selected poem.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Poet

        public Poet()
        Creates a new Poet, where the actual poet is selected randomly. The instance variables
        name (a String);
        topics (an array of Strings); and
        poems (an array of Strings)
        are set to the correct values for the selected poet. The default value for instance variable debugging is false.

    • Method Detail

      • getTopics

        public java.lang.String getTopics()
        Provides the menu of possible poems for the current poet.
        Returns:
        The menu of possible topics as a String.

      • getPoem

        public java.lang.String getPoem(int choice)
        Returns the selected poem.
        Parameters:
        choice - the index of the requested poem (must be one of the options given by the menu for this poet.
        Returns:
        the text of the selected poem
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the indicated choice is not in the list of poems.

      • debug

        public void debug(java.lang.String message)
        A utility method for use in development stages. If the instance variable debug(java.lang.String) is true then the argument is printed to stderr (typically to the console) preceded by the string represenation of this Poet, otherwise nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        message - the debugging message to output

      • setDebugging

        public void setDebugging(boolean db)
        Sets whether debug(String) messages will be printed or not.
        Parameters:
        db - if true then debug messages will be printed
